lead_paragraph: After a catastrophic flood in 1993, the residents of Valmeyer, Ill., picked up their town and moved to a bluff a mile and a half away. But they miss the old town on the Mississippi River.

headline.print_headline: Drowned, Resurrected and Wistful for Old Home
headline.main: A Town Drowned and Resurrected on a Bluff Misses Its Old Home

snippet: After a catastrophic flood in 1993, the residents of Valmeyer, Ill., picked up their town and moved to a bluff a mile and a half away. But they miss the old town on the Mississippi River.
abstract: Residents of Valmeyer, Ill, who moved town en masse in 1993 following devastating Great Flood of Mississippi River to location over a mile east, say they are homesick for old town, which they still call Old Valmeyer; residents have avoided December 2015 flooding that has destroyed other cities along river, bringing back surge of bad memories.
